stories.text:
Hackers tend to throw around "trivial" in open source discussions, articles and even here on hackernews.

What does it mean? does it mean the problem is so easy you don't even have to think about?
stories.title: Ask HN: What Does “Trivial” Mean?

stories.text:
According to this video shared by Zelensky Facebook page: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HucqNfL1oYA (youth link for those who don’t use FB).

Surely the documents in the video and his phone aren’t decisive for the war, but since a text inside an image can be easily deblurred using -lots of- ML tools available, it isn’t a bit unsafe share video like this?

Maybe for a video is different but, if deblurring an image is not a trouble for me, I don’t think it’s a hard trouble for the Russian IT guys to deblur a video.

Someone should alert the Zelensky’s social staff it, or I’m missing something?
stories.title: Tell HN: Zelensky is blurring -not blanking- sensitive info in a video with Musk
